lines.content: This documentation serves as a compilation of how and where AI was used in this project.
The AI was tasked with improving the GUI in terms of suggesting a colour scheme that fits the theme of
"having a hamster as a buddy" and the GUI layout.
A warm yellow theme was proposed to match the colour of yellow hamsters. Variants of blue was
A padding was proposed to be placed in the anchorPane.
Given the Parser, Storage and Command classes, the AI was tasked with finding out if any user inputs will
Several flaws were found by AI just through one look at the code. The following inputs will cause the software to crash upon the next start up:
The following solution was proposed and implemented: **Use character escaping**

* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* Constructs a {@code Momo} instance with default components.
* Initializes the parser, task manager, and GUI handler.
* Processes one user input and returns Momo's response string for GUI.
* @return Response message to display in GUI.
* Command-line interface entry point for legacy use.
* Initializes the CLI {@link Ui} and starts the main controller loop.
* Base type for all executable user commands in the application.
* Each concrete command represents an action to be performed on the application's
* state and is executed with access to a {@code TaskManager} and {@code Ui}.
* Executes the command using the given task manager and UI.
* @param taskManager Task manager that provides access to and modifies the tasks.
* @param ui UI handler used to display messages to the user.
* @return {@code true} if the application should exit after executing this command,
* @throws MomoException If the command cannot be executed due to invalid input,
public abstract boolean execute(TaskManager taskManager, Ui ui) throws MomoException;

* @throws InvalidArgumentException If the title is blank/missing or the due date is missing.

* Main controller responsible for coordinating the main execution loop: reads user input,

* Starts the main execution loop of the application.
* This method displays the welcome message, repeatedly reads user input,
* parses and executes commands, and handles exceptions.
* Storage-related errors terminate the application, while other
* {@link MomoException}s are reported and allow continued execution.
* Exception thrown when a valid command is provided with invalid arguments (e.g OOB, missing parameters)
* Constructs a new exception with a error message that includes a suggested correct command format.
* @param msg Suggested correct usage or command format.
* Exception thrown when a user enters an unrecognized or unsupported command.
* Constructs a new exception with a default error message.
super("Sorry >.< but Momo don't understand. Could you repeat again?");

* Root exception type for all Momo-specific runtime exceptions.
* All application-specific runtime exceptions should extend this class.
* It represents errors that occur during command processing, storage,
* Constructs a new Momo exception with the specified message.
* Exception thrown when an error occurs during task storage operations.
* This exception represents failures related to reading from or writing to
* persistent storage, such as corrupted data or file access issues.
* Constructs a new storage exception with the specified message.
* @param message Description of the storage error.
